result.execSummary:
The defendant Nickolas J Krimmer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
DNA Sample
Huber
Consecutive to: to 15CM37

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Nickolas J Krimmer

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Nickolas J Krimmer in court with attorney Rick Terrence Cveykus.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 15CM25, 15CM173 and 15CM37 @ 2:21 p.m. Agreement stated - 15CM25 - plea to ct 1, ct 2 dismiss and read in, $100 plus costs, reserve right to expunge after 1 yr if all court obligations paid and no crimes to probable cause. 15CM37 - plea to ct 1, cts 2 & 3 dismiss and read in, 5 days jail, court costs, not reserving right to expunge. 15CM173 stipulate 20 days jail consecutive to 15CM37, $100 plus costs, not reserving right to expunge. DNA only on 15CM173. Atty Cveykus agrees. No objection to applying bonds to costs. Def agrees. Court reviews plea quest. 15CM25 ct 1 - no contest plea. Ct 2 dismissed and read in. 15CM37 ct 1 - no contest plea. Cts 2 & 3 dismissed and read in. 15CM173 no contest plea. Constitutional rights, elements, possible penalties reviewed. Atty Cveykus satisfied. Court finds Def understands and pleas freely & voluntarily made. Factual basis stipulated. Atty Cveykus withdraws any outstanding motions. Court accepts pleas and finds guilty of 15CM173 and 15CM37 bail jumping and 15CM25 possess THC. State asks Court to follow agreement and that bonds be applied to all cases. Atty Cveykus asks for 30 days to report. No objection. Nothing by Defendant. Sentencing remarks by the Court. Court finds agreement reasonable.
15CM25 ct 1 - $100 plus costs, reserve right to expunge under 973.015 after 1 yr if all court obligations paid and no new crimes to probable cause. Recall 8/30/16 @ 1:00 p.m. 
15CM37 ct 1 - 5 days jail, commence no later than 6 p.m. on 9/27/15. Court costs. 
15CM173 ct 1 - 20 days jail, consecutive to 15CM37, huber on both, $100 plus costs, DNA sample and surcharge. DNA colloquy. Apply bonds to all fines, return any balance to poster. Add to pmt plan if needed. Postconviction rights.

Attorney Rick Terrence Cveykus in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.Court calls 15CM25, 15CM173 & 15CM37 @ 8:57 am. Atty Cveykus can't explain where def. is.  State request warrant body only & 15CM173 moves to forfeit, 15CM37 moves to forfeit bond. Court authorize warrant body only, statewide, & 15CM173 Forfeit 1150.00 subject to hearing, 15CM37 Forfeit $100.00 subject to hearing.

Defendant Nickolas J Krimmer in court with attorney Rick Cveykus.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  9:07 a.m./Case called.  15-CM-37 and 15-CM-25 also called.  All cases to be set for plea and sentencing.  Set for 8-27-15/8:30 a.m.  15-CM-173/Def. has copy of complaint.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued. Defendant Nickolas J Krimmer in court with attorney Rick Terrence Cveykus.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Nickolas J Krimmer in court.  Ralph Malcom Uttke appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court calls  @ 3:08 pm.  Def. has copy of complaint, advised of charges and penalties.  Def. given atty rights. State heard on bond.  Court orders $1150.00 cash bond, already posted.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 09:00 am.
